Subtitle.Text: it felt like velvet all over my body.
But I will always wait for him.
seem like a glass of milk
it gives life to us women of the night.
with what we can't find on shore.
What’s up? How are you doing?
We're on our way to Chile.
I think I won’t make it.
Legend has it that to break a spell,
one has to cross forty waves.
who has crossed thousands of waves.
I was yearning for the sea
and for the far reaches of the world.
I wanted to check how round our earth is.
And like a child of the high seas
I was just strolling in familiar places.
I wanted to ride the steel
and enter the heart of the ocean.
He could have been the love of my life.
fly into his vessel and say:
The one I used to be... Sandy!"
who always let herself be loved
who left her behind, in oblivion.
I wonder if any of them remember me
Maybe, only the sea will tell.
I feel it speaks to me sometimes.
I look at the sea and it fills me up.
Sometimes I soak my feet in it
as looking at it from here.
All my feelings lay there, on the water.
making them exude a body heat
different from that of men on land
and this bitter taste I adore...
I will run towards the sea
and take him in my arms.
As if I'd never missed him
I'll pour all my love over him
Who knows, would it be so?
until I'd lost sight of him for good?
I like to be where dreams are.
The feelings we have on land
In the darkness of the sea
In the beauty of the night
In the darkness of the sea
You are in a wonderful garden.
There, the night becomes your friend.
When I started in the night life
and was dancing as I could
I was announced to the crowd
The white goddess of blazing rhythms!"
I had to change my name.
On my way from south to north
But Sandy and Marilyn are one...
I hold my Marilyn close to my heart.
I was feeling like a shaman.
I was just a tiny cell
part of a larger, infinite whole.
I would like to return to China,
And greet these people so dear to me.
I miss them, I want to go back.
I am a part of them
and they are a part of me.
But can you ask from the wind
Can you have day and night
How can you be a sailor
if you stay in one place?
Then, you would be an immigrant.
crying over his love left in Chile.
new destinations will lose their meaning.
He must find the courage to leave.
He won’t let habit kill the dream.
Feeling at home in the ocean
When you cross the ocean over months
you need to learn to love the people
There is always something new to see.
How could women not be part of all this?
going through every word of the song
that I cannot express in writing,
Where have you gone, my Nicos?
the feel of velvet on my body.
with some kind of Greek honey.
and perhaps I have gone crazy,
when I get the most nostalgic.
I used to wait for my "husbands".
I would have been a great actress.
I like thinking that you never die
But now I can no longer
You can’t be in the presence
When I dared say to my mother
"Each time I take my clothes off...
I pretend to be a mannequin
showing myself as a piece of art."
I don’t see it as something vulgar.
When I receive the money, maybe.
But money makes the world go round.
We used to drink, eat, sing...
swear eternal love to each other!
I kept one piece in my pocket!
The ship sailed away and I screamed:
"No! I want to go with him
I'll throw myself into the water."
would throw their ring into the water.
to avoid having to pay them each time.
The jeweler got the best profit!
It was true madness for seamen.
We made such scandals on the water!
were only meant for the Greeks.
we would merely kiss and hug.
But with the Greeks it was passionate.
The day I'll leave this place
I don’t want to hear this word
The bomb explodes when they go away
As if they arrive on enemy territory
of all the girls in the neighborhood.
To love somebody who pays you.
Yet again, I was longing for my stars.
I wouldn't be the same if I stayed.
And I would do the same thing.
I’d go hunting for mermaids again
in the middle of the ocean.
Now it's time to be alone.
It's like getting an electric discharge
But when caressed, it feels good
and you end up exhausted, not burned.
men leave behind, such as love.
A forest has gentle and violent plants
such as a man in sexual trance.
and you don’t want the night to end.
the guy gets up and leaves.
are meant to be taken and left behind.
so many moments in your life.
who used to caress your hair...
the mirror to a woman’s face
These days it's a bit neglected
'cause it’s expensive to keep it nice.
But I have always loved my hair.
The Greeks used to caress it and say...
Now, wrinkles is all that’s left.
Look at the little birds out there.
Look at what's left of a woman’s body
after having fought against the sailors.
Look at what’s left of their gazelle.
not by a dog, but by man.
we follow the laws of biology.
but that’s the way it is.
But God didn’t want it that way.
They may have had different fathers.
They may have had multiple skin colors
but they would have been mine.
we are sort of empty in life.
That's why whenever I am around sailors
and I see them so young
I think they could be my men's children
trying to buy a moment of happiness
because of how much they loved me.
I didn’t realize they hurt me.
Thus I thank God I can remember
I even turned misfortune into happiness
and be able to help others
from an unfortunate woman of the night
I don’t think it was the blows
was it when I held Nicos
A life where order and security
A life where all the roads go straight?
Like wheat stalks in a field,
One day someone mows them down
and that’s the end of the story.
Drama, not in a sad meaning.
My eyes are not good enough to see
yet I can perceive the lights
I see your image passing by.
you help him forget what hurts.
You offer him the waters of Lethe.
Will you be blond and tall
Will it be you, or not?
Wind and salt water will tell me.
